name: Samuel Ronick
aboutMe:
I’m Samuel Chukwuwike Ronick, a full stack web developer with 5+ years of experience building high-performance applications. I specialize in React, Next.js, Node.js, MongoDB, GraphQL, and AWS/GCP, delivering scalable solutions that drive business growth.

I’ve led projects that reduced response times by 30%, streamlined social media automation, and integrated advanced payment and authentication systems. My expertise spans from developing robust APIs to optimizing performance and deploying cloud-native architectures.

blogs.title: Deploy Express App as AWS Lambda Container with API Gateway using Terraform
blogs.description: This tutorial provides a step-by-step guide to containerizing your application, deploying it to AWS Elastic Container Registry (ECR), creating a Lambda function from the container image, and connecting it to API Gateway, all using Terraform for efficiency and simplicity.

blogs.title: Step-by-Step Guide: How to Set Up Meta WhatsApp API to Manage WhatsApp Business Accounts (WABA) - Part One
blogs.description: Step-by-Step Guide: How to Set Up Meta WhatsApp API to Manage WhatsApp Business Accounts (WABA)

blogs.title: Step-by-Step Guide: How to Set Up Meta WhatsApp API to Manage WhatsApp Business Accounts (WABA) - Part Two
blogs.description: In Part Two of this tutorial, you'll learn how to onboard WhatsApp Business Accounts (WABA), set up webhooks to receive events, and explore additional WhatsApp endpoints for various business applications, following the "Get Started for Tech Providers" or "Get Started for Solution Partners" guides.

blogs.title: A Comprehensive Guide to Software Testing Principles and Strategies
blogs.description: This article addresses common questions about software testing, highlighting its importance in the development process for both startups and large enterprises. It emphasizes how effective testing contributes to enhancing software quality, reliability, and robustness.

projects.title: Kindroom - Robust Room Booking Platform
projects.description: Kindroom is a dynamic room booking platform designed to streamline the process of finding and reserving accommodation. My role involved building both the front-end and back-end, with a focus on performance optimization, security, and user experience.

contributions.heading: Back-end Highlights:
contributions: Developed a GraphQL API server that improved response times by 30%.
Implemented authentication and role-based authorization using Firebase Auth for secure access control.
Integrated a comprehensive Stripe payment system for smooth transaction handling, covering payment methods and subscription schedules.
Designed efficient MongoDB connections and data models with Mongoose for managing room data.
Built a data filtering and query system using MongoDB operators and aggregations, allowing users to search and filter rooms based on various criteria.

contributions.heading: Front-end Highlights:
contributions: Connected the front-end with the GraphQL API for real-time data fetching.
Utilized Next.js server-side rendering for better SEO and improved page performance.
Managed state efficiently using Recoil and React, enhancing the user experience.
Implemented lazy loading and code splitting techniques to optimize the page load time and reduce bundle size.
Ensured robust security by integrating Firebase to manage and secure user sessions.

projects.summary: The project was a collaborative effort, ensuring alignment with business requirements while maintaining a high level of user experience.
